definition: outstanding/particularly, especially/a fault/to express discontentment against
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: This is particularly noticeable in the winter and when driving lots of short journeys with cold starts.
sentences.chinese: 这在冬季和冷启动大量的短途驾驶时尤为明显。

sentences.english: Thetwist at the end is especially noteworthy.
sentences.chinese: 结尾笔锋一转尤为引人注目。

sentences.english: But the Chinese, some experts say, are notably adept.
sentences.chinese: 但是，一些专家说，中国对此尤为熟练。

sentences.english: Fox conflicts over religion in many parts of Shanxi Province, in particular, is especially prevalent in Jinzhong.
sentences.chinese: 狐突信仰遍及山西许多地区，特别是在晋中尤为盛行。

sentences.english: B: Right. It seems to be quite important to Chinese culture.
sentences.chinese: 对，对中国文化来说，这一点显得尤为重要。

sentences.english: This is especially true of any programming art in its second or later generation.
sentences.chinese: 这对于任何编程技术的第二代及更后代尤为正确。

sentences.english: Dry year is relatively common in loess region, particularly spring drought.
sentences.chinese: 黄土丘陵区干早年份较常见，春旱尤为严重。

sentences.english: In the agricultural trade field, the disputes are more intricacy .
sentences.chinese: 在农产品贸易领域，贸易摩擦尤为复杂。

sentences.english: It is important to check with a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 经医生检查这一关尤为重要。

sentences.english: Scientists have more respect for elevated spiritual states.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们对高尚的精神尤为尊重。

sentences.english: Mrs. Yin, our only lady there behaved particularly well, so that we stopped worrying that she wouldl cry.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一的女伴尹工尤为出色，当时真担心她会哭。

sentences.english: In his teaching, Confucius attached great importance of "Songs".
sentences.chinese: 在孔门教学中，孔子对《诗》尤为重视。

sentences.english: Confidentiality may be particularly stringentin this case.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，保密性显得尤为重要。

sentences.english: Mining stocks, which are especially sensitive to economic growth prospects led the gains.
sentences.chinese: 对各国经济增长预期业尤为敏感的矿业板块涨幅居前。

sentences.english: Investigate and research work has an important signification for the economy crime detection.
sentences.chinese: 调研对于经侦工作显得尤为重要。

sentences.english: This paper focuses on the formal verification of MANET non-secure and secure routing protocols.
sentences.chinese: 在安全问题中，路由协议的正确性尤为重要。

definition: very/completely/utterly/extremely/absolutely/hundred percent/to divide into ten equal parts
increasingly/more and more/ever more/all the more
